statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: UNLV 81, Colorado State 79
article.story: FORT COLLINS, Colo. (AP) -- Odartey Blankson had 31 points and 12 rebounds as UNLV held on to win a season-high fourth straight game with an 81-79 victory over Colorado State Monday night. Blankson was 11-for-20 shooting and came within two points of matching a career high in scoring. Romel Beck added 17 points for UNLV (13-11, 5-6 Mountain West Conference). Matt Nelson scored 24 points to lead Colorado State (10-15 2-10), which lost for the ninth time in 10 games. Sean Morris, who had 31 points in the teams' first meeting, had 19 points, but missed a chance to tie the game in the final 21 seconds. Blankson scored six and Michael Umeh, had 14 points, as UNLV turned a six-point deficit into a 60-51 lead with 11:15 remaining. The Rams rallied as Nelson tied it at 64-64 with a basket and free throw. UNLV picked up its interior defense on one end and Blankson scored on an inside move and 3-pointer to put the Rebels ahead 77-69 only to have Colorado State get within 79-76 after Jason Smith's basket with 58 seconds left. The Rams had two chances to tie it after two UNLV turnovers, but Nelson lost the ball and Morris later missed a 3-pointer with 21 seconds left. Umeh and Jerel Blassingame sealed the game with a free throw each. Colorado State led by as much as 13 points, but had its lead cut to 37-31 by halftime as Blankson scored four points in the last minute and 48 seconds.
